result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy J Stone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs are paid in full from bond on file.  DNA surcharge not ordered.
Sentence to start on or before October 23, 2015 at 6:00 pm.  May serve on EMP, according to jail rules.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy J Stone

defendant.name: Stone, Randy J

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  No joint recommendation.  Victim notification complied with.  Victim wishes to make a statement.  No request for restitution.   Defendant plead guilty to Count 1 as charged.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties he plead to.  Exhibits 1 and 2 marked.  Offered by the defense.  Court admitted.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights and entered his plea.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of domestic disorderly conduct.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.   Vicitm made a statement.  State recommended 15-20 days jail.  Credit for 3 days.  Defense recommended fine only.  Court takes notice of defendant's current medications.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.   Court ordered:  30 days jail, imposed and stayed. 1 year probation.  Continue meds exactly as directed.  Agent to determine counseling needed.  Defendant does not want probation.  Court ordered 30 days jail.  Credit for time served.  CC, no DNA surcharge.  Start on or before 10/23/15 at 6 pm.    May serve on EMP.  Pay costs @ $100/mo 12/15/15.    Failure to pay any part of the fine and court costs will result in 30 days jail.

Defendant appeared with counsel James Ritland.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Ritland states they are still working on an amendment to the agreement so they are not ready to plead.  HIs client has 3 weeks left to complete the Alternatives to Aggression Program and requests 1 month adjournment.  ADA Inlow states this should be the last extension.  Court grants 1 month adjournment and plea/sentencing will be rescheduled.
Carly called from Judge Goodman's office - case has been rescheduled and requested we send notice.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-17-2015 08:30 am
AEP Clerked.  ADA Inlow and Attorney Ritland called Judge Goodman in Monroe County.   Plea/sentencing set for 6/26/15 at 11:30 am

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 04-29-2015 10:00 am

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney James Ritland.  Attorney Ritland wishes to proceed with the initial appearance.  Reading of complaint waived, defendant stands mute.  NGP entered by court.  Court found probable cause.  Court ordered defendant to submit DNA sample by the end of the week.  Attorney Ritland objected.  Objection noted for the record.  PTC date set.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared through his Attorney, James Ritland.  Per Attorney Ritland, the victim is requesting that the no contact condition be lifted.  DA Fox argues against.  Court ordered that bond be continued as previously ordered.  Attorney Ritland to file a motion before Judge Becker if he is still requesting that condition be lifted.

Defendant appeared without counsel.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Court advised defendant of charges and possible penalties.  He states he understands.  He is getting an attorney but needs more time.  He also states he wishes to return to the residence to maintain the woodstove. He's requesting a signature bond.  Court sets adjourned initial appearance date fo 4-6-15 at 9:30 and advises defendant to bring his attorney to that hearing.  Cash bond is amended down and also conditions amended.  Clerked by JM.
